results.content: BS3 was current when this class was created. BS4 was current this year (2020). Finding your way around how to find the differences was a much better learning experience than just following along! Not for the faint of heart tho'.  I'm sure there is a newer version out there.  Converting this project was a great life lesson.
results.content_html: BS3 was current when this class was created. BS4 was current this year (2020). Finding your way around how to find the differences was a much better learning experience than just following along! Not for the faint of heart tho'. I'm sure there is a newer version out there. Converting this project was a great life lesson.

results.content: The Javascript Tooltip and Popover instructions didn't work for me. I had to copy other code from Bootstrap examples to get it to work. The last 2 lessons seemed to be in reverse order. Modals were already on the 2nd to last lesson and the last lesson was modals. The code didn't match the exercise instructions. I was writing the code as I went. Maybe if I used the provided exercise files the code might have matched. I didn't check that. Overall it was a pretty good course.

results.content: Good presentation.  Instructor is knowledgeable and clear in his delivery.  Content should be proofed before presenting, however.  There were two Wells on the components page and the word great was misspelled as grate in the introduction.  Also, instead of duplicating content on every page, it might have been good to use include files.
results.content_html: Good presentation. Instructor is knowledgeable and clear in his delivery. Content should be proofed before presenting, however. There were two Wells on the components page and the word great was misspelled as grate in the introduction. Also, instead of duplicating content on every page, it might have been good to use include files.

results.content: I needed a quick Bootstrap overview and this is what I got. Could the course be better? Yes. But there are longer courses for that.
results.content_html: I needed a quick Bootstrap overview and this is what I got. Could the course be better? Yes. But there are longer courses for that.

results.content: I'm learning about Bootstrap, sure, but the instructor seems pretty disorganized, and he is constantly telling you WHAT he is doing, but not necessarily WHY he is doing it.
results.content_html: I'm learning about Bootstrap, sure, but the instructor seems pretty disorganized, and he is constantly telling you WHAT he is doing, but not necessarily WHY he is doing it.

results.content: This course would have been a lot better with just some simple video editing. The instructor frequently makes mistakes during the videos and sometimes struggles to figure out what is causing the error. It is very hard to have confidence in an instructor when you can see how sloppy they are.
results.content_html: This course would have been a lot better with just some simple video editing. The instructor frequently makes mistakes during the videos and sometimes struggles to figure out what is causing the error. It is very hard to have confidence in an instructor when you can see how sloppy they are.

results.content: Was interesting but for bootstrap he goes a little fast for people that don't understand bootstrap not much personality either with this instructor.
results.content_html: Was interesting but for bootstrap he goes a little fast for people that don't understand bootstrap not much personality either with this instructor.

results.content: A good basic overview of Bootstrap. Some important concepts aren't covered (e.g. when talking about the grid system the trainer uses .col-md-* classes and doesn't explain the difference between these and .col-xs-*, .col-sm-*, .col-lg-* and why you might want to use one over the others). Also lessons 10 and 11 seem to be the wrong way around. But otherwise a good intro to Bootstrap that covers the basics.
results.content_html: A good basic overview of Bootstrap. Some important concepts aren't covered (e.g. when talking about the grid system the trainer uses .col-md-* classes and doesn't explain the difference between these and .col-xs-*, .col-sm-*, .col-lg-* and why you might want to use one over the others). Also lessons 10 and 11 seem to be the wrong way around. But otherwise a good intro to Bootstrap that covers the basics.

results.content: This course is an easy to follow example of how to use Bootstrap. Not for beginning web developers because you need to understand HTML and CSS; however, as an introduction to how easy it is to use Bootstrap to save development time , this course is very good.
results.content_html: This course is an easy to follow example of how to use Bootstrap. Not for beginning web developers because you need to understand HTML and CSS; however, as an introduction to how easy it is to use Bootstrap to save development time , this course is very good.

results.content:
Found this course pretty boring, and I think it is not about Bootstrap. It's just about a copy and paste code. Teacher does not even explain the difference between col-md and col-sm or col-lg, for example. 

So I think this course is a bit incomplete. You can learn more about Bootstrap if you start reading documentation. You can actually skip this course, it takes more time for nothing.

It is free so start with this if you don't find nothing better for you. I'm sorry but I would not suggest it to you.
results.content_html:
Found this course pretty boring, and I think it is not about Bootstrap. It's just about a copy and paste code. Teacher does not even explain the difference between col-md and col-sm or col-lg, for example.

So I think this course is a bit incomplete. You can learn more about Bootstrap if you start reading documentation. You can actually skip this course, it takes more time for nothing.

It is free so start with this if you don't find nothing better for you. I'm sorry but I would not suggest it to you.

results.content:
I just came for my attachment and during the interview was asked whether I am conversant with Bootstrap Framework. I said no, and all the interviewers were surprised. 
I thought it was real hard stuff like a new programming language altogether.
I am so pleased to learn is so easy and fast and to get to understand its power!
Thank you for the course and to the Bootstrap developers

results.content: Very well said and presented. Thanks for all that you do for people like me who want to learn and improve upon what we already know. I feel like you need to explain more about the bootstrap/css. For example I had to constantly stop the video in order to figure out what class: media, pull-left, media body & etc...etc... meant. I was under the impression that this was a class for beginners not for intermediate or advanced which to me means more explanation should be provided so that when the student is done with your course they can conduct further research based on what you have explained. I didn't know that those classes were bootstrap classes. Now I know
results.content_html: Very well said and presented. Thanks for all that you do for people like me who want to learn and improve upon what we already know.
